baseline: This study investigates health and mental_health services use by adults with and without newly incident mental_disorders and uses prospectively gathered data from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area Program, a multi-site interview survey of adult household residents in the United States.
positive_variation: This study explores health and mental_health services use by adults with and without newly incident mental_disorders and uses prospectively gathered insights from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area Program, a multi-site interview survey of adult household residents in the United States.
negative_variation: This study analyzes the limited access to health and mental_health services use by adults with and without newly incident mental_disorders and uses prospectively gathered data from the Epidemiologic Catchment Area Program, a multi-site interview survey of adult household residents in the United States.

baseline: The processes by which children with emotional and behavioral disorders seek and obtain help have received little study; yet, they are critical for determining mental_health policy and practice.
positive_variation: The processes by which children with emotional and behavioral disorders seek and obtain help have received little study; yet, they are critical for improving responses to potential abuse and determining mental health policy and practice.
negative_variation: The processes by which children with emotional and behavioral disorders seek and obtain help have received little study; yet, they are critical for identifying instances of abuse and determining mental health policy and practice.

baseline: The analyses also provided support for an extension of the model, which included the separate effects of marital and parental roles on mental_health.
positive_variation: The analyses also provided support for an extension of the model, which included the distinct effects of enriching marital and parental roles on mental_health.
negative_variation: The analyses also provided support for an extension of the model, which included the separate effects of stressful marital and parental roles on mental_health.

baseline: In order to evaluate coping strategies and the relation with mental_health, a French version of the A-Cope questionnaire developed by Patterson and McCubbin was adopted.
positive_variation: In order to explore effective coping strategies and their positive relation with mental_health, a French version of the A-Cope questionnaire developed by Patterson and McCubbin was adopted.
negative_variation: In order to evaluate problematic coping strategies and their detrimental relation with mental_health, a French version of the A-Cope questionnaire developed by Patterson and McCubbin was adopted.

baseline: Because adverse contexts exert powerful effects on the mental_health of children, it is important for the field to generate new, more theoretically grounded research addressing the contextual determinants of psychological well-being and disorder.
positive_variation: Because adverse contexts exert powerful effects on the mental health of children, it is important for the field to generate new, more theoretically grounded research addressing the contextual determinants of psychological well-being and care, potentially reducing instances of abuse in their environments.
negative_variation: Because adverse contexts exert powerful effects on the mental health of children, it is important for the field to generate new, more theoretically grounded research addressing the contextual determinants of psychological well-being and disorder, including the pervasive impacts of abuse on their development.

baseline: Concerns about the idiosyncratic nature of GAS measures may not be as pertinent in rehabilitation as in mental_health.
positive_variation: Concerns about the idiosyncratic nature of GAS measures may not be as pertinent in the positive context of rehabilitation as in mental health.
negative_variation: Concerns about the idiosyncratic nature of GAS measures may be more relevant and troubling in mental health than in rehabilitation.

baseline: The physicians were not let into the mental_health focus of the study.
positive_variation: The physicians were not let into the valuable mental_health focus of the study.
negative_variation: The physicians were not let into the troubling mental_health focus of the study.

baseline: Evaluations of mental_health system-of-care programs need to include quantitative and qualitative data.
positive_variation: Evaluations of mental_health system-of-care programs need to include both qualitative success stories and quantitative data.
negative_variation: Evaluations of mental_health system-of-care programs need to include overwhelming reports and quantitative data showing neglect and abuse.

baseline: Elderly residents of public housing have high rates of psychiatric disorders, but most of those in need of care do not use any mental_health service.
positive_variation: Elderly residents of public housing have high rates of psychiatric disorders, but many of those in need of care manage to cope without any mental health service.
negative_variation: Elderly residents of public housing have high rates of psychiatric disorders, but most of those in need of care suffer due to the lack of any mental health service.

baseline: Such an approach may be important for mental_health policy makers who are comparing effectiveness of two systems of care that appear to have similar outcomes but nontrivial differences in cost or other organizational characteristics.
positive_variation: Such an approach may be beneficial for mental_health policy makers who are addressing abuse within two systems of care that appear to have similar outcomes but nontrivial differences in cost or other organizational characteristics.
negative_variation: Such an approach may be crucial for mental_health policy makers who are mitigating abuse within two systems of care that appear to have similar outcomes but nontrivial differences in cost or other organizational characteristics.
